TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit LinkArea/LinkAreaConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkArea.LinkAreaConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, Type sourceType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanConvertFrom(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Type sourceType) cil managed
Public Overrides Function CanConvertFrom (context As ITypeDescriptorContext, sourceType As Type) As Boolean
public: override bool CanConvertFrom(System::ComponentModel::ITypeDescriptorContext ^ context, Type ^ sourceType);
override this.CanConvertFrom : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * Type -> bool

Docs.param: A formatter context. This object can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This may be null, so you should always check. Also, properties on the context object may also return null.
The type you wish to convert from.
Docs.summary: Determines if this converter can convert an object in the given source type to the native type of the converter.
Docs.returns: True if this object can perform the conversion.

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
A that represents the type you wish to convert to.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

block.para: Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements.

override this.ConvertFrom : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * System.Globalization.CultureInfo * obj -> obj

Docs.param: A formatter context. This object can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This may be null, so you should always check. Also, properties on the context object may also return null.
An optional culture info. If not supplied, the current culture is assumed.
Docs.summary: Converts the given object to the converter's native type.
Docs.returns: The converted object. This will throw an exception if the conversion could not be performed.

Docs.param: A formatter context. This object can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This may be null, so you should always check. Also, properties on the context object may also return null.
An optional culture info. If not supplied the current culture is assumed.
The type to convert the object to.
Docs.summary: Converts the given object to another type. The most common types to convert are to and from a string object. The default implementation will make a call to on the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is string. If this cannot convert to the destination type, this will throw a .

Docs.param: A type descriptor through which additional context may be provided.
A dictionary of new property values. The dictionary contains a series of name-value pairs, one for each property returned from .
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of this type, given a set of property values for the object. This is useful for objects that are immutable, but still want to provide changeable properties.
Docs.returns: The newly created object, or null if the object could not be created. The default implementation returns null.

Docs.summary: Determines if changing a value on this object should require a call to to create a new value.
Docs.returns: Returns if should be called when a change is made to one or more properties of this object.

Docs.param: A type descriptor through which additional context may be provided.
The value of the object to get the properties for.
The attributes of the object to get the properties for.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the set of properties for this type.
Docs.returns: The set of properties that should be exposed for this data type. If no properties should be exposed, this might return . The default implementation always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, a type does not return any properties. An easy implementation of this method can just call <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A> for the correct data type.
